item.name: Angel of Mercy
item.text: Flying When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

item.name: Eager Cadet
item.flavorText: "Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the ‘training' I needed."

item.name: Angelic Blessing
item.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
item.flavorText: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

item.name: Vengeance
item.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
item.flavorText: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.

item.name: Aven Cloudchaser
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.

item.name: Coral Eel
item.flavorText: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

item.name: Aven Flock
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) {W}: Aven Flock gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Just as each added feather steadies the wing, so does the flock grow stronger with each new member.

item.name: Giant Octopus
item.flavorText: "Before my eyes was a horrible monster, worthy to figure in the legends of the marvellous. . . . Its eight arms, or rather feet, fixed to its head . . . were twice as long as its body, and were twisted like the furies' hair." —Jules Verne, Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea, trans. Lewis

item.name: Ballista Squad
item.text: {X}{W}, {T}: Ballista Squad deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
item.flavorText: The perfect antidote for a tightly packed formation.

item.name: Index
item.text: Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
item.flavorText: "Let's see . . . Mercadia, mercenary, merfolk . . . you know, I really need a better filing system."

item.name: Blessed Orator
item.text: Other creatures you control get +0/+1.
item.flavorText: "He spoke with the tongue of Angels; we fought with the strength of lions." —Handel, infantry soldier

item.name: Blinding Angel
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) Whenever Blinding Angel deals combat damage to a player, that player skips his or her next combat phase.
item.flavorText: "Their eyes will shrivel and blacken before faith's true light."

item.name: Vizzerdrix
item.flavorText: A bored wizard once created a vizzerdrix out of a bunny and a piranha. He never made that mistake again.

item.name: Blinking Spirit
item.text: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "Don't look at it Maybe it'll go away" —Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

item.name: Goblin Raider
item.text: Goblin Raider can't block.
item.flavorText: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit and run.

item.name: Chastise
item.text: Destroy target attacking creature. You gain life equal to its power.
item.flavorText: "Why do we pray to the Ancestor? Because She listens." —Mystic elder

item.name: Enormous Baloth
item.flavorText: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.

item.name: Circle of Protection: Black
item.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

item.name: Spined Wurm
item.flavorText: "I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now that's a plan" —Wandering mage

item.name: Circle of Protection: Red
item.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

item.name: Crossbow Infantry
item.text: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
item.flavorText: "He can split a marshfly in two from halfway across the range." —Onean sergeant

item.name: Demystify
item.text: Destroy target enchantment.

item.name: Foot Soldiers
item.flavorText: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

item.name: Gift of Estates
item.text: If an opponent controls more lands than you, search your library for up to three Plains cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

item.name: Glorious Anthem
item.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
item.flavorText: Each victory adds a new verse.

item.name: Glory Seeker
item.flavorText: The turning of the tide always begins with one soldier's decision to head back into the fray.

item.name: Holy Day
item.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
item.flavorText: "The day of Spirits; my soul's calm retreat / Which none disturb" —Henry Vaughan, "The Night"

item.name: Holy Strength
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
item.flavorText: Such power protects the body with the strength of the soul.

item.name: Honor Guard
item.text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The strength of one. The courage of ten.

item.name: Infantry Veteran
item.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "This scar? From a zombie's teeth. This scar? From a barbarian's axe. That scar? I don't talk about that one."

item.name: Inspirit
item.text: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+4 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "The hour of your redemption is here. . . . Rally to me. . . . rise and strike. Strike at every favorable opportunity. For your homes and hearths, strike" —General Douglas MacArthur, to the people of the Philippines

item.name: Ivory Mask
item.text: You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
item.flavorText: Made from its wearer's hopes, the mask ensures that those hopes will be fulfilled.

item.name: Kami of Old Stone
item.flavorText: "There was a wall here. Now it is dust. A tower rose here. Now it is fallen. An army fought here. Now it is dead. A spirit was here. It is all that remains." —Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

item.name: Leonin Skyhunter
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
item.flavorText: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.

item.name: Marble Titan
item.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
item.flavorText: It entered the temple with all the pomp and decorum of a rock hitting a goblin's skull.

item.name: Master Decoy
item.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
item.flavorText: A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again.

item.name: Master Healer
item.text: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: Behind his eyes is the pain of every soldier his hands have healed.

item.name: Mending Hands
item.text: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: "I can staunch their blood, mend their flesh, and knit their bones. But I cannot restore their hope." —Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

item.name: Oracle's Attendants
item.text: {T}: All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn by a source of your choice is dealt to Oracle's Attendants instead.
item.flavorText: They follow the prophecy to each new prophet, guarding the future from the present.

item.name: Pacifism
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
item.flavorText: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

item.name: Paladin en-Vec
item.text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)

item.name: Peace of Mind
item.text: {W}, Discard a card: You gain 3 life.
item.flavorText: "What can a peasant get for free that an emperor can never buy?" —Dal riddle

item.name: Pegasus Charger
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

item.name: Reverse Damage
item.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
item.flavorText: "My enemy's hatred is his weakness. My enemy's anger is my strength." —Remin, venerable monk

item.name: Righteousness
item.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.

item.name: Sacred Ground
item.text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.
item.flavorText: The knight knelt and prayed, first for the sanctity of his land and second for the strength to repel its invaders.

item.name: Sacred Nectar
item.text: You gain 4 life.
item.flavorText: "Over the silver mountains, Where spring the nectar fountains, There will I kiss The bowl of bliss; And drink my everlasting fill. . . ." —Sir Walter Raleigh, "The Pilgrimage"

item.name: Samite Healer
item.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

item.name: Sanctum Guardian
item.text: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage.

item.name: Savannah Lions
item.flavorText: Even the brave are scared by a lion three times: first by its tracks, again by its roar, and one last time face to face. —Somali proverb

item.name: Seasoned Marshal
item.text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
item.flavorText: "We are not interested in the possibilities of defeat." —Queen Victoria

item.name: Serra Angel
item.text: Flying Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
item.flavorText: When she flies above the good, they consider themselves blessed. When she flies above the wicked, they consider themselves dead.

item.name: Serra's Blessing
item.text: Creatures you control have vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)
item.flavorText: "Rise, and I will show you how to run without flagging, fight without raging, and fly without wings."

item.name: Skyhunter Prowler
item.text: Flying, vigilance (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

item.name: Soul Warden
item.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost. —Vec teaching

item.name: Spirit Link
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

item.name: Story Circle
item.text: As Story Circle enters the battlefield, choose a color. {W}: The next time a source of your choice of the chosen color would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

item.name: Suntail Hawk
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
item.flavorText: Its eye the glaring sun, its cry the keening wind.

item.name: Tempest of Light
item.text: Destroy all enchantments.
item.flavorText: "Let everything return to its true nature, so that destiny may take its course."

item.name: Venerable Monk
item.text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
item.flavorText: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.

item.name: Veteran Cavalier
item.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
item.flavorText: Spirit is the sword and experience the sharpening stone. —Arabian proverb

item.name: Warrior's Honor
item.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave." —Calvin Coolidge

item.name: Weathered Wayfarer
item.text: {W}, {T}: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Activate this ability only if an opponent controls more lands than you.

item.name: Worship
item.text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
item.flavorText: "Believe in the ideal, not the idol." —Serra

item.name: Wrath of God
item.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

item.name: Zealous Inquisitor
item.text: {1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Zealous Inquisitor this turn is dealt to target creature instead.
item.flavorText: Wine and balm for the confessions of the repentant. Razors and irons for the confessions of the unrepentant.

item.name: Air Elemental
item.text: Flying
item.flavorText: Pray that it doesn't seek the safety of your lungs.

item.name: Annex
item.text: Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.) You control enchanted land.
item.flavorText: You should see how small the map is.

item.name: Archivist
item.text: {T}: Draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Sit down and read. Educate yourself for the coming conflicts." —Mary Harris "Mother" Jones

item.name: Aven Fisher
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) When Aven Fisher is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may draw a card.
item.flavorText: The same spears that catch their food today will defend their homes tomorrow.

item.name: Aven Windreader
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) {1}{U}: Target player reveals the top card of his or her library.
item.flavorText: "The tiniest ripple tells a story ten fathoms deep."

item.name: Azure Drake
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
item.flavorText: Little dreamt could seem so cruel As waiting for the wings outspread, The jagged teeth, the burning eyes, And dagger-claws that clench to nerves.

item.name: Baleful Stare
item.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Mountain and red card in it.
item.flavorText: "Though there is little to be learned from your dust and stones, I shall wring them dry nevertheless."

item.name: Battle of Wits
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 200 or more cards in your library, you win the game.
item.flavorText: The wizard who reads a thousand books is powerful. The wizard who memorizes a thousand books is insane.

item.name: Boomerang
item.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "Returne from whence ye came. . . ." —Edmund Spenser, The Faerie Queene

item.name: Clone
item.text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.

item.name: Confiscate
item.text: Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.) You control enchanted permanent.

item.name: Counsel of the Soratami
item.text: Draw two cards.
item.flavorText: "Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."

item.name: Cowardice
item.text: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)

item.name: Crafty Pathmage
item.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.
item.flavorText: Follow the pathmage —Otarian expression meaning "escape quickly"

item.name: Daring Apprentice
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
item.flavorText: In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.

item.name: Dehydration
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

item.name: Dream Prowler
item.text: Dream Prowler is unblockable as long as it's attacking alone.
item.flavorText: "To think that some find sleep a restful state." —Volrath

item.name: Evacuation
item.text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
item.flavorText: Which is more unsettling: the roar of battle or the silence that follows?

item.name: Exhaustion
item.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
item.flavorText: Tired doesn't even begin to cover it.

item.name: Fishliver Oil
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an Island.)

item.name: Fleeting Image
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) {1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow." —Aesop, Fables, trans. Jacobs

item.name: Flight
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

item.name: Fugitive Wizard
item.flavorText: The College of Lat-Nam is often forced to expel students whose experiments grow too risky or too cruel.

item.name: Horned Turtle
item.flavorText: It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.

item.name: Imaginary Pet
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have a card in hand, return Imaginary Pet to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "It followed me home. Can I keep it?"

item.name: Levitation
item.text: Creatures you control have flying.
item.flavorText: Barrin's pride in his apprentice was diminished somewhat when he had to get the others back down.

item.name: Lumengrid Warden
item.flavorText: His peers derive knowledge from ancient tomes locked within dark spires. He finds knowledge within the solitude of a lifetime spent watching the Quicksilver Sea.

item.name: Mahamoti Djinn
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
item.flavorText: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

item.name: Mana Leak
item.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
item.flavorText: The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.

item.name: Mind Bend
item.text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

item.name: Phantom Warrior
item.text: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.
item.flavorText: "There are as many pillows of illusion as flakes in a snow-storm. We wake from one dream into another dream." —Ralph Waldo Emerson, "Illusions"

item.name: Plagiarize
item.text: Until end of turn, if target player would draw a card, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Are you thinking what I'm thinking?"

item.name: Polymorph
item.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.

item.name: Puppeteer
item.text: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
item.flavorText: "Getting people to do what you want is merely a matter of telling them what they want to hear."

item.name: Reminisce
item.text: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.
item.flavorText: Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges.

item.name: Remove Soul
item.text: Counter target creature spell.
item.flavorText: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

item.name: Rewind
item.text: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.
item.flavorText: "Let's go over this one more time. . . ."

item.name: Sage Aven
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) When Sage Aven enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

item.name: Sea Monster
item.text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
item.flavorText: It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.

item.name: Sea's Claim
item.text: Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.) Enchanted land is an Island.
item.flavorText: "Who's the crazy one now?" —Torgle, mountaintop boatmaker

item.name: Sift
item.text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
item.flavorText: Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.

item.name: Sleight of Hand
item.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
item.flavorText: "Gambling with mages never is." —Remin, venerable monk

item.name: Storm Crow
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
item.flavorText: Storm crow descending, winter unending. Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

item.name: Telepathy
item.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
item.flavorText: "Secrets? What secrets?"

item.name: Temporal Adept
item.text: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "If yesterday was two days ago tomorrow, will the day after tomorrow be today or yesterday?" —Temporal Manipulation 101 final exam, Tolarian Academy

item.name: Thieving Magpie
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
item.flavorText: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies steal jewels for theirs.

item.name: Thought Courier
item.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
item.flavorText: "There's an assortment to satisfy all your needs: deep, fleeting, dirty, pure, scientific, philosophical, after, and even fore. For a price."

item.name: Tidal Kraken
item.text: Tidal Kraken is unblockable.
item.flavorText: To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.

item.name: Tidings
item.text: Draw four cards.
item.flavorText: "Though the letter was many pages long, I could tell all I needed to know from one look at the messenger's face." —Barrin, master wizard

item.name: Time Ebb
item.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
item.flavorText: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

item.name: Trade Routes
item.text: {1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand. {1}, Discard a land card: Draw a card.
item.flavorText: The wise, the righteous, the mighty—the merchant feeds them all.

item.name: Traumatize
item.text: Target player puts the top half of his or her library, rounded down, into his or her graveyard.
item.flavorText: You won't know what you're missing.

item.name: Treasure Trove
item.text: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Wealth means power; the power to subdue, to crush, to exploit, the power to enslave, to outrage, to degrade." —Emma Goldman, "Anarchism"

item.name: Wanderguard Sentry
item.text: When Wanderguard Sentry enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
item.flavorText: It allows those with dangerous weapons to pass. But not those with dangerous thoughts.

item.name: Wind Drake
item.text: Flying
item.flavorText: "But high she shoots through air and light, Above all low delay, Where nothing earthly bounds her flight, Nor shadow dims her way." —Thomas Moore, "Oh that I had Wings"

item.name: Withering Gaze
item.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Forest and green card in it.
item.flavorText: "Nature cares not for the knowledge to be gained from its study. Better to bleed it dry, lest its potential be wasted on lizards and leaves."

item.name: Zur's Weirding
item.text: Players play with their hands revealed. If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

item.name: Blackmail
item.text: Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card.
item.flavorText: In addition to killing peasants, punishing subordinates, and raising an army of nightmares, Braids somehow found time for her favorite hobby: petty extortion.

item.name: Bog Imp
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
item.flavorText: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.

item.name: Bog Wraith
item.text: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
item.flavorText: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.

item.name: Coercion
item.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
item.flavorText: "Of all I that I have lost, I miss my mind the most."

item.name: Consume Spirit
item.text: Spend only black mana on X. Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.
item.flavorText: "Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine." —Mayvar, minion of Geth

item.name: Contaminated Bond
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.

item.name: Cruel Edict
item.text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
item.flavorText: "No mockeries now for them; no prayers nor bells, / Nor any voice of mourning save the choirs,— / The shrill, demented choirs of wailing shells." —Wilfred Owen, "Anthem for Doomed Youth"

item.name: Dark Banishing
item.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: "Ha, banishment? Be merciful, say ‘death,' For exile hath more terror in his look, Much more than death." —William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet

item.name: Death Pits of Rath
item.text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: "Neither could I forget what I had read of these pits—that the sudden extinction of life formed no part of their most horrible plan." —Edgar Allan Poe, "The Pit and the Pendulum"

item.name: Deathgazer
item.text: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
item.flavorText: Your entire life passes before its eyes.

item.name: Diabolic Tutor
item.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.

item.name: Drudge Skeletons
item.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
item.flavorText: "The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off." —Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook

item.name: Enfeeblement
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
item.flavorText: "If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it." —Kaervek

item.name: Execute
item.text: Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated. Draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead." —Cabal Patriarch

item.name: Fear
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
item.flavorText: "Don't fear the darkness. Fear what it hides." —Remin, venerable monk

item.name: Festering Goblin
item.text: When Festering Goblin is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.

item.name: Final Punishment
item.text: Target player loses life equal to the damage already dealt to him or her this turn.
item.flavorText: The pain of a lifetime—every scrape, illness, and bruise—condensed into a single moment.

item.name: Foul Imp
item.text: Flying When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
item.flavorText: The imp, unaware of its own odor, paused to catch its breath . . . and promptly died.

item.name: Giant Cockroach
item.flavorText: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.

item.name: Gluttonous Zombie
item.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
item.flavorText: Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.

item.name: Grave Pact
item.text: Whenever a creature you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, each other player sacrifices a creature.
item.flavorText: "The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave." —Crovax, ascendant evincar

item.name: Gravedigger
item.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

item.name: Hell's Caretaker
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

item.name: Highway Robber
item.text: When Highway Robber enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
item.flavorText: "Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."

item.name: Hollow Dogs
item.text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

item.name: Horror of Horrors
item.text: Sacrifice a Swamp: Regenerate target black creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

item.name: Hypnotic Specter
item.text: Flying Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

item.name: Looming Shade
item.text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.

item.name: Lord of the Undead
item.text: Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1. {1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: "I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"

item.name: Megrim
item.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
item.flavorText: "You can run from your pain, but you will tire before it does." —Gerrard of the Weatherlight

item.name: Mind Rot
item.text: Target player discards two cards.
item.flavorText: "The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them." —Volrath

item.name: Mindslicer
item.text: When Mindslicer is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, each player discards his or her hand.
item.flavorText: It is the thing that goes bump in the night.

item.name: Mortivore
item.text: Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards. {B}: Regenerate Mortivore. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

item.name: Nantuko Husk
item.text: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace. —Nantuko teaching

item.name: Nekrataal
item.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.) When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

item.name: Nightmare
item.text: Flying Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
item.flavorText: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

item.name: Persecute
item.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.
item.flavorText: "Of all the tyrannies on humane kind The worst is that which persecutes the mind." —John Dryden, "The Hind and the Panther"

item.name: Phyrexian Arena
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
item.flavorText: A drop of humanity for a sea of power.

item.name: Phyrexian Gargantua
item.text: When Phyrexian Gargantua enters the battlefield, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
item.flavorText: Other Phyrexians have nightmares about the gargantua.

item.name: Plague Beetle
item.text: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
item.flavorText: No one knows whether they were named for the disease they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.

item.name: Plague Wind
item.text: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: "The second wind of ascension is Reaver, slaying the unworthy." —Keld Triumphant

item.name: Raise Dead
item.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

item.name: Ravenous Rats
item.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
item.flavorText: Nothing is sacred to the rats. Everything is simply another meal.

item.name: Razortooth Rats
item.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
item.flavorText: "Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us." —Crovax, ascendant evincar

item.name: Royal Assassin
item.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
item.flavorText: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

item.name: Scathe Zombies
item.flavorText: "They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose, Nor spake, nor moved their eyes; It had been strange, even in a dream, To have seen those dead men rise." —Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

item.name: Sengir Vampire
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn is put into a graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
item.flavorText: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

item.name: Serpent Warrior
item.text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
item.flavorText: They are incubated by swamp gases and cut their teeth on zombie flesh. Serpent warriors are not to be trifled with.

item.name: Slay
item.text: Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated. Draw a card.
item.flavorText: The elves had the edge in guile, skill, and valor. But in the end, only sheer numbers mattered.

item.name: Soul Feast
item.text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
item.flavorText: You are who you eat.

item.name: Spineless Thug
item.text: Spineless Thug can't block.
item.flavorText: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.

item.name: Swarm of Rats
item.text: Swarm of Rats's power is equal to the number of Rats you control.
item.flavorText: "Rats, rats, rats Hundreds, thousands, millions of them, and every one a life." —Bram Stoker, Dracula

item.name: Underworld Dreams
item.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.
item.flavorText: "In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan." —Rabindranath Tagore

item.name: Unholy Strength
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
item.flavorText: Such power grows the body as it shrinks the soul.

item.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) {B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

item.name: Yawgmoth Demon
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.) At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you don't, tap Yawgmoth Demon and it deals 2 damage to you.

item.name: Zombify
item.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it." —Mystic elder

item.name: Anaba Shaman
item.text: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: Just try taking this bull by the horns.

item.name: Anarchist
item.text: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: Those who will not follow are doomed to lead.

item.name: Balduvian Barbarians
item.flavorText: "From the snowy slopes of Kaelor, To the canyons of Bandu, We drink and fight and feast and die As we were born to do." —Balduvian tavern song

item.name: Blaze
item.text: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: Fire never dies alone.

item.name: Blood Moon
item.text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.
item.flavorText: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.

item.name: Bloodfire Colossus
item.text: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Colossus: Bloodfire Colossus deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
item.flavorText: It took all its strength to contain the fire within.

item.name: Boiling Seas
item.text: Destroy all Islands.
item.flavorText: What burns the land, boils the seas.

item.name: Demolish
item.text: Destroy target artifact or land.
item.flavorText: "Pound the steel until it fits. Doesn't work? Bash to bits." —Dwarven forging song

item.name: Enrage
item.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The barbarians call it "touching the soul of the dragon."

item.name: Firebreathing
item.text: Enchant creature {R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

item.name: Flame Wave
item.text: Flame Wave deals 4 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.
item.flavorText: "I hear the roaring of a wave whose waters are red and whose mists are black." —Oracle en-Vec

item.name: Flashfires
item.text: Destroy all Plains.
item.flavorText: Dry grass is tinder before the spark.

item.name: Flowstone Crusher
item.text: {R}: Flowstone Crusher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "What's better than smashing things with a rock? A rock that gets up and smashes things for you." —Toggo, goblin weaponsmith

item.name: Flowstone Shambler
item.text: {R}: Flowstone Shambler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Flowstone troops are notoriously difficult to keep in formation.

item.name: Flowstone Slide
item.text: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.
item.flavorText: It may look like soil, but its nature is malice.

item.name: Form of the Dragon
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Form of the Dragon deals 5 damage to target creature or player. At the beginning of each end step, your life total becomes 5. Creatures without flying can't attack you.

item.name: Furnace of Rath
item.text: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
item.flavorText: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.

item.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
item.text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
item.flavorText: They patched the holes, loaded their sharpest rocks, spanked their children one last time, and lurched off into the sunset.

item.name: Goblin Brigand
item.text: Goblin Brigand attacks each turn if able.
item.flavorText: Like a loaded cannon—point and shoot.

item.name: Goblin Chariot
item.text: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
item.flavorText: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

item.name: Goblin King
item.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
item.flavorText: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .

item.name: Goblin Mountaineer
item.text: Mountainwalk
item.flavorText: The only thing worse than a goblin is a goblin that knows his way around.

item.name: Goblin Piker
item.flavorText: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

item.name: Goblin Sky Raider
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
item.flavorText: The goblin word for "flying" is more accurately translated as "falling slowly."

item.name: Guerrilla Tactics
item.text: Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to target creature or player. When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

item.name: Hill Giant
item.flavorText: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

item.name: Karplusan Yeti
item.text: {T}: Karplusan Yeti deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Karplusan Yeti.

item.name: Kird Ape
item.text: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.
item.flavorText: It puts the "fur" in "fury."

item.name: Lava Axe
item.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
item.flavorText: "Catch"

item.name: Lightning Elemental
item.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
item.flavorText: "A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave, He passes from life to his rest in the grave." —William Knox, "Mortality"

item.name: Magnivore
item.text: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.) Magnivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of sorcery cards in all graveyards.

item.name: Mana Clash
item.text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

item.name: Mogg Sentry
item.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Nothing makes a mogg madder than having to wake up.

item.name: Ogre Taskmaster
item.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
item.flavorText: Three little goblins, enjoying their brew. One bumped an ogre, and then there were two.

item.name: Orcish Artillery
item.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
item.flavorText: "So they want to kill my men? Well two can play at that game." —General Khurzog

item.name: Panic Attack
item.text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
item.flavorText: Sometimes everyone decides to go for help at the same time.

item.name: Pyroclasm
item.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
item.flavorText: "When the air burns, only death breathes deep." —Bogardan mage

item.name: Raging Goblin
item.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
item.flavorText: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

item.name: Rathi Dragon
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) When Rathi Dragon enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice two Mountains.

item.name: Reflexes
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

item.name: Relentless Assault
item.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
item.flavorText: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

item.name: Rogue Kavu
item.text: Whenever Rogue Kavu attacks alone, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Every litter of kavu yields one cub that refuses to hunt with the pack.

item.name: Rukh Egg
item.text: When Rukh Egg is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, put a 4/4 red Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.
item.flavorText: Called "stonefeathers" by many lowlanders, rukhs are thought to descend from a phoenix that sacrificed its flame for a body of stone.

item.name: Sandstone Warrior
item.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.) {R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

item.name: Seething Song
item.text: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: "The purest ore is produced from the hottest furnace, and the brightest thunder-bolt is elicited from the darkest storm." —Charles Colton

item.name: Shard Phoenix
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) Sacrifice Shard Phoenix: Shard Phoenix deals 2 damage to each creature without flying. {R}{R}{R}: Return Shard Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

item.name: Shatter
item.text: Destroy target artifact.

item.name: Shivan Dragon
item.text: Flying {R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

item.name: Shock
item.text: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: "Once I saw a goblin shouting at a thunderstorm. He lost the argument pretty quickly." —Wandering mage

item.name: Stone Rain
item.text: Destroy target land.

item.name: Sudden Impact
item.text: Sudden Impact deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.
item.flavorText: "Some say it's better to think before you act. While those people are considering all the options, that's usually when I kill them." —Dravus, lava mage

item.name: Threaten
item.text: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
item.flavorText: Goblins' motivational techniques are crude, but effective.

item.name: Thundermare
item.text: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.) When Thundermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
item.flavorText: Its hooves strike lightning and the thunder follows quickly after.

item.name: Viashino Sandstalker
item.text: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.) At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
item.flavorText: "Some believe sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better." —Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

item.name: Volcanic Hammer
item.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

item.name: Whip Sergeant
item.text: {R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack this turn.)
item.flavorText: Keldon soldiers learn to move faster than the whip.

item.name: Wildfire
item.text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
item.flavorText: Fire is always at the top of the food chain, and it has a big appetite.

item.name: Anaconda
item.text: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
item.flavorText: If you're smaller than the anaconda, it considers you food. If you're larger than the anaconda, it considers you a lot of food.

item.name: Ancient Silverback
item.text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

item.name: Biorhythm
item.text: Each player's life total becomes the number of creatures he or she controls.
item.flavorText: "I have seen life's purpose, and now it is my own." —Kamahl, druid acolyte

item.name: Blanchwood Armor
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.

item.name: Craw Wurm
item.flavorText: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

item.name: Creeping Mold
item.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
item.flavorText: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.

item.name: Early Harvest
item.text: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.
item.flavorText: "Earth's increase, foison plenty, Barns and garners never empty: Vines with clust'ring bunches growing; Plants with goodly burden bowing." —William Shakespeare, The Tempest

item.name: Elvish Bard
item.text: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.
item.flavorText: Helplessly drawn in, the bard's enemies quickly find there's more than song to be found.

item.name: Elvish Berserker
item.text: Whenever Elvish Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
item.flavorText: Their fury scatters enemies like a pile of dry leaves.

item.name: Elvish Champion
item.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
item.flavorText: "For what are leaves but countless blades To fight a countless foe on high." —Elvish hymn

item.name: Elvish Piper
item.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more. —Elvish teaching

item.name: Elvish Warrior
item.flavorText: "My tales of war are the stories most asked for around the fires at night, but they're the ones I care least to tell."

item.name: Emperor Crocodile
item.text: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.
item.flavorText: The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation.

item.name: Force of Nature
item.text: Trample (If this creature would deal enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.) At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

item.name: Giant Growth
item.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

item.name: Giant Spider
item.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
item.flavorText: Watching the spider's web —Llanowar expression meaning "focusing on the wrong thing"

item.name: Greater Good
item.text: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then discard three cards.
item.flavorText: "To examine the causes of life, we must first have recourse to death." —Mary Shelley, Frankenstein

item.name: Grizzly Bears
item.flavorText: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

item.name: Groundskeeper
item.text: {1}{G}: Return target basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: "Soldiers speak of defending the soil, but they care only for their nations. I care nothing for their nations and everything for the soil."

item.name: Hunted Wumpus
item.text: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.

item.name: Kavu Climber
item.text: When Kavu Climber enters the battlefield, draw a card.
item.flavorText: "There was a crack of branches, a rustle of leaves, then a tremendous roar. Our party had no chance as death descended from above." —Taseen, elvish bard

item.name: King Cheetah
item.text: Flash
item.flavorText: If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a king cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend. —Suq'Ata wisdom

item.name: Ley Druid
item.text: {T}: Untap target land.
item.flavorText: After years of training, the druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

item.name: Llanowar Behemoth
item.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Llanowar Behemoth gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Most people can't build decent weapons out of stone or steel. Trust the elves to do it with only mud and vines." —Gerrard of the Weatherlight

item.name: Llanowar Elves
item.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot. —Llanowar penalty for trespassing

item.name: Maro
item.text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
item.flavorText: No two see the same Maro.

item.name: Might of Oaks
item.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this"

item.name: Natural Affinity
item.text: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
item.flavorText: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.

item.name: Natural Spring
item.text: Target player gains 8 life.
item.flavorText: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.

item.name: Naturalize
item.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
item.flavorText: "Well, it also makes a very nice flower pot. . . ." —Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

item.name: Needle Storm
item.text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.
item.flavorText: The rain is driven like nails.

item.name: Norwood Ranger
item.flavorText: The song of the forest is in perfect harmony. If a single note is out of place, the elves will find its source.

item.name: Order of the Sacred Bell
item.flavorText: "My brother, it may now be time to ring the bell and put out the call for aid."

item.name: Overgrowth
item.text: Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.) Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G}{G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

item.name: Rampant Growth
item.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: Nature grows solutions to her problems.

item.name: Reclaim
item.text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
item.flavorText: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.

item.name: Regeneration
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) {G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

item.name: River Bear
item.text: Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an Island.)
item.flavorText: The bears had been isolated on an island for hundreds of years, until the island sank and the bears didn't.

item.name: Rootbreaker Wurm
item.text: Trample (If this creature would deal enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

item.name: Rootwalla
item.text: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
item.flavorText: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.

item.name: Scaled Wurm
item.flavorText: The wurms become so big, a single scale can be used as a roof for a human dwelling.

item.name: Seedborn Muse
item.text: Untap all permanents you control during each other player's untap step.
item.flavorText: "Her voice is the wilderness, savage and pure." —Kamahl, druid acolyte

item.name: Silklash Spider
item.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.) {X}{G}{G}: Silklash Spider deals X damage to each creature with flying.
item.flavorText: The only thing that flies over the Krosan Forest is the wind.

item.name: Stream of Life
item.text: Target player gains X life.

item.name: Summer Bloom
item.text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
item.flavorText: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

item.name: Trained Armodon
item.flavorText: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

item.name: Tree Monkey
item.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
item.flavorText: The vines and branches of the jungle canopy are all the wings it needs.

item.name: Treetop Bracers
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
item.flavorText: Gravity is truly what you make of it.

item.name: Utopia Tree
item.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: The fruit of this fabled tree takes on the flavor of whatever food you love most.

item.name: Verdant Force
item.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Verduran Enchantress
item.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Graceful? Yes. Beautiful? Absolutely. Harmless? Definitely not." —Fyndhorn elder

item.name: Viridian Shaman
item.text: When Viridian Shaman enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
item.flavorText: She stands as a living symbol of the natural world and an enemy of the forces that threaten it.

item.name: Web
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

item.name: Weird Harvest
item.text: Each player may search his or her library for up to X creature cards, reveal those cards, and put them into his or her hand. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.
item.flavorText: Krosa's distorted groves bear strange fruit.

item.name: Wood Elves
item.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.

item.name: Yavimaya Enchantress
item.text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
item.flavorText: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.

item.name: Zodiac Monkey
item.text: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
item.flavorText: It lives mainly on fruit, leaves, and the occasional nose.

item.name: Aladdin's Ring
item.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: "A good lamp will light your way. A good ring will clear it." —Nervan, royal jeweler

item.name: Angel's Feather
item.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: If taken, it cuts the hand that clutches it. If given, it heals the hand that holds it.

item.name: Beast of Burden
item.text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
item.flavorText: Though it was built as an instrument of labor, it wasn't long before it became an instrument of war.

item.name: Booby Trap
item.text: As Booby Trap enters the battlefield, name a card other than a basic land card and choose an opponent. The chosen player reveals each card he or she draws. When the chosen player draws the named card, sacrifice Booby Trap. If you do, Booby Trap deals 10 damage to that player.

item.name: Bottle Gnomes
item.text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.
item.flavorText: Reinforcements . . . or refreshments?

item.name: Coat of Arms
item.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
item.flavorText: "Hup, two, three, four, Dunno how to count no more."

item.name: Dancing Scimitar
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
item.flavorText: A blade that has never known sheath, a hilt that has never known hand.

item.name: Defense Grid
item.text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.
item.flavorText: It lights up the sky, beckoning enemies only to repel them.

item.name: Demon's Horn
item.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.

item.name: Disrupting Scepter
item.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.
item.flavorText: "True power is controlling not only the hearts of your subjects, but their minds as well."

item.name: Dragon's Claw
item.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.

item.name: Fellwar Stone
item.text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
item.flavorText: "What do you have that I cannot obtain?" —Mairsil, the Pretender

item.name: Howling Mine
item.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
item.flavorText: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.

item.name: Icy Manipulator
item.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
item.flavorText: In fire there is the spark of chaos and destruction, the seed of life. In ice there is perfect tranquility, perfect order, and the silence of death.

item.name: Jade Statue
item.text: {2}: Jade Statue becomes a 3/6 Golem artifact creature until end of combat. Activate this ability only during combat.
item.flavorText: "The paradox of jade statues is that their victims never really expect attack, but they are never completely surprised either." —Kabel, Tolarian archivist

item.name: Jester's Cap
item.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Cap: Search target player's library for three cards and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
item.flavorText: "Know your foes' strengths as well as their weaknesses." —Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

item.name: Kraken's Eye
item.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.

item.name: Loxodon Warhammer
item.text: Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink. (If the creature would deal enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker. Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.) Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

item.name: Millstone
item.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
item.flavorText: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.

item.name: Ornithopter
item.text: Flying
item.flavorText: "It has been my honor to improve on the Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work." —Urza, in his apprenticeship

item.name: Phyrexian Hulk
item.flavorText: It doesn't think. It doesn't feel. It doesn't laugh or cry. All it does from dusk till dawn Is make the soldiers die. —Onean children's rhyme

item.name: Rod of Ruin
item.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.

item.name: Slate of Ancestry
item.text: {4}, {T}, Discard your hand: Draw a card for each creature you control.
item.flavorText: The pattern of life can be studied like a book, if you know how to read it.

item.name: Spellbook
item.text: You have no maximum hand size.
item.flavorText: "Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again." —Karn, silver golem

item.name: Storage Matrix
item.text: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, each player chooses artifact, creature, or land during his or her untap step. That player can untap only permanents of the chosen type this step.

item.name: Tanglebloom
item.text: {1}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: The bloom contains no seeds. It's meant only to nourish the forest's inhabitants.

item.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
item.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

item.name: Thran Golem
item.text: As long as Thran Golem is enchanted, it gets +2/+2 and has flying, first strike, and trample.
item.flavorText: As a beaver's teeth grow unchecked without regular use, so does the golem's armor grow without regular battles.

item.name: Ur-Golem's Eye
item.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: It still stares accusingly at Memnarch, though millennia have passed since he separated the eye from its body.

item.name: Vulshok Morningstar
item.text: Equipped creature gets +2/+2. Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

item.name: Wurm's Tooth
item.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.

item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool. Battlefield Forge deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Brushland
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Caves of Koilos
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool. Caves of Koilos deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Karplusan Forest
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Karplusan Forest deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Llanowar Wastes
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool. Llanowar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Quicksand
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}, Sacrifice Quicksand: Target attacking creature without flying gets -1/-2 until end of turn.

item.name: Shivan Reef
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool. Shivan Reef deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Sulfurous Springs
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Sulfurous Springs deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Underground River
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Underground River deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Urza's Mine
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

item.name: Urza's Power Plant
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

item.name: Urza's Tower
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.

item.name: Yavimaya Coast
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool. Yavimaya Coast deals 1 damage to you.
